node.title: Genomic sequencing confirms link between current NT COVID outbreak and earlier cluster
node.alt: A long line of people queuing up for COVID testing in Katherine.
node.description: Genomic sequencing has confirmed the Northern Territoryâ€™s current COVID-19 outbreak is linked to a previous cluster that was sparked earlier this month by an interstate arrival who lied on her border entry form.
node.content: ["Genomic sequencing has confirmed the Northern Territory\u2019s current COVID-19 outbreak is linked to a previous cluster that was sparked earlier this month by an interstate arrival who lied on her border entry form.", "The 21-year-old woman flew to Darwin from Cairns, in Far North Queensland, and later\u00a0tested positive in the NT.", "Her case was only discovered after a close contact, a 26-year-old man who had spent time in Katherine and Darwin, was identified as a positive COVID-19 case on November 4.", "The man's case\u00a0triggered a lockdown in Katherine and a lockout in Darwin, during which three more positive cases emerged.", "The woman was subsequently identified as the source of the initial outbreak and was fined more than $5,000 for failing to disclose a previous trip to Melbourne, which is a\u00a0declared COVID-19 hotspot.", "Restrictions in Katherine were eased on November 8 but the town, as well as the Robinson River remote community, were placed in lockdown on November 15 after two new cases emerged.", "Since then, a total of 19 people \u2014 all of whom are Aboriginal Territorians \u2014 have tested positive to the virus.", "Because of the gap between the first and second group of cases, authorities were unsure if the two clusters were linked.", "More to come."]
